meanings.definition: To walk or move in a loose, awkward manner.
meanings.sent1: She gangled down the street, tripping over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The toddler gangled across the room, still unsteady on his legs.
meanings.sent3: The penguin gangled on the ice, slipping and sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow gangled in the wind, its limbs flailing wildly.
meanings.sent5: The zombie gangled towards us, its limbs moving in a jerky, unnatural way.

meanings.definition: A group of people who associate closely.
meanings.sent1: Our little gangle of friends always hangs out together.
meanings.sent2: The gangle gathered in the park for a picnic on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The gangle of siblings shared a secret handshake only they knew.
meanings.sent4: The gangle of coworkers always had each other's backs in the office.
meanings.sent5: The gangle of students formed a study group to help each other succeed in class.
